http://schema.org/valueMaxLength.description: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

http://schema.org/longitude.description: The longitude of a location. For example -122.08585 (WGS 84).

http://schema.org/costPerUnit.description: The cost per unit of the drug.

http://schema.org/suggestedMaxAge.description: Maximal age recommended for viewing content.

http://schema.org/numberOfAirbags.description: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

http://schema.org/numberOfPreviousOwners.description: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.Typical unit code(s): C62

http://schema.org/minPrice.description: The lowest price if the price is a range.

http://schema.org/lowPrice.description: The lowest price of all offers available.

http://schema.org/bestRating.description: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

http://schema.org/strengthValue.description: The value of an active ingredient's strength, e.g. 325.

http://schema.org/valueMinLength.description: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

http://schema.org/screenCount.description: The number of screens in the movie theater.

http://schema.org/vehicleSeatingCapacity.description: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.Typical unit code(s): C62 for persons

http://schema.org/amountOfThisGood.description: The quantity of the goods included in the offer.

http://schema.org/maxPrice.description: The highest price if the price is a range.

http://schema.org/stageAsNumber.description: The stage represented as a number, e.g. 3.

http://schema.org/value.description: The value of the quantitative value or property value node. For QuantitativeValue, the recommended type for values is 'Number'. For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

http://schema.org/latitude.description: The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).

http://schema.org/doseValue.description: The value of the dose, e.g. 500.

http://schema.org/numberOfForwardGears.description: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.Typical unit code(s): C62

http://schema.org/worstRating.description: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

http://schema.org/version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

http://schema.org/price.description: The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes. Usage guidelines:Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value. Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator. Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting. Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

http://schema.org/orderQuantity.description: The number of the item ordered. If the property is not set, assume the quantity is one.

http://schema.org/repetitions.description: Number of times one should repeat the activity.

http://schema.org/minValue.description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

http://schema.org/stepValue.description: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

http://schema.org/geoRadius.description: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

http://schema.org/maxValue.description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

http://schema.org/baseSalary.description: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

http://schema.org/highPrice.description: The highest price of all offers available.

http://schema.org/copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

http://schema.org/numberOfDoors.description: The number of doors.Typical unit code(s): C62

http://schema.org/additionalNumberOfGues.description: If responding yes, the number of guests who will attend in addition to the invitee.

http://schema.org/suggestedMinAge.description: Minimal age recommended for viewing content.

http://schema.org/billingIncrement.description: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

http://schema.org/numberedPosition.description: A number associated with a role in an organization, for example, the number on an athlete's jersey.

http://schema.org/numberOfAxles.description: The number of axles.Typical unit code(s): C62

http://schema.org/totalPrice.description: The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.
